message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.COMM, cs.SY, cs.PHYS

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper proposes an optimal metric for opportunistic scheduling in a MIMO-RF/FSO system, which involves analyzing the performance of the system in terms of outage probabilities. This falls under the scope of information theory.
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper deals with underlay cognitive radio networks, which involve sharing of spectrum resources among multiple users. This falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture.
3. cs.COMM (Communication and Networking) - The paper proposes a system for opportunistic scheduling in a MIMO-RF/FSO network, which involves analyzing the performance of the system in terms of outage probabilities. This falls under the scope of communication and networking.
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a system for opportunistic scheduling in a MIMO-RF/FSO network, which involves analyzing the performance of the system in terms of outage probabilities. This falls under the scope of systems and control.
5. cs.PHYS (Physics and Society) - The paper models the FSO link between the relay and destination eNodeB as the Generalized M\'{a}laga $(\mathcal{M})$ turbulence channel with pointing errors. This falls under the scope of physics and society.
